Description: The HHS Office of Inspector General announced that medical equipment supplier Lincare Holdings Inc. and its subsidiary Lincare Inc. agreed to pay $10 million to resolve allegations that it paid illegal kickbacks and violated the Physician Self-Referral (also known as Stark) Law. Lincare also agreed to be bound to a five-year company-wide corporate integrity agreement.
Agency: Health & Human Services Department Office of Inspector General

Description: Lincare Inc., a national medical equipment company based in Clearwater, Florida, agreed to pay the United States more than three million dollars to resolve allegations that it improperly billed Medicare for home-oxygen equipment, therapeutic ventilators and the respiratory drug albuterol sulfate.

Air Program

Operated a facility as a major source of hazardous air pollutants without a Class I permit. Installation Permit Violations: failed to continuously monitor and record at its VES stack. Failure to sample and analyze ambient air particulate matter. Constructed a third arsine synthesis reactor without an AQ permit. Failed to report excess emissions, permit deviations and failed to submit compliance certifications.
